sentences.english: And then all this earthquake happened, I thought, is that Karma?-when you are not nice that bad things happen to you.
sentences.chinese: 然后地震发生了，我当时就想，这难道是因果报应？

sentences.english: As for the other resultant mental states that occur during the rest of life, they number thirty-two.
sentences.chinese: 在生命的其余时间生起的果报心共有三十二种。

sentences.english: Supreme fruition is without hope and fear.
sentences.chinese: 最圆满的果报是无希求和恐惧。

sentences.english: The Buddha has always warned us against karmic retribution.
sentences.chinese: 佛说因果报应丝毫不爽。

sentences.english: Apparently, many people now believe in Karma.
sentences.chinese: 显然，有很多人相信因果报应。

sentences.english: This is an example of karmic retribution and how inescapable it is.
sentences.chinese: 你们看因果报应何等不爽。

sentences.english: It may serve you, however, to be aware of consequences.
sentences.chinese: 因果报应会使你对做事的后果有所警觉。

sentences.english: Ideal of karma runs through the whole early Chinese translation of Buddhist sutra.
sentences.chinese: 因果报应观念贯穿了整个初传汉译佛经叙事。

sentences.english: There is no prise or punishment in nature, only comeuppance .
sentences.chinese: 自然界中没有奖赏和惩罚，只有因果报应。
我知我的因缘果报存活着。

sentences.english: Does karma factor in when a shark snatches up a fish?
sentences.chinese: 当一只鲨鱼掠取一只鱼时是因果报应吗？

sentences.english: Heaven above weighs the scales; you need not seek far.
sentences.chinese: 殃样果报无虚谬，咫尺青天莫远求。

definition: karmic hindrance (buddhism)/karmic consequences that stand in the way of enlightenment/(term of abuse, especially toward the younger generation) devil spawn/(fig.) money
chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
to be reborn/to live in paradise (Buddhism)/to die/(after) one's death
collective karma (Buddhism)/consequences that all must suffer
to give food (as a charity)/"feeding the hungry ghosts" (Buddhist ceremony)
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
to abandon suffering and obtain happiness (Buddhism)
to do good works/to be merciful
